articles.headline: Tech Stocks Boom, but Some Stock Pickers Are Wary
articles.snippet: The explosion in index-tracking E.T.F.s and soaring tech stocks have put traditional mutual fund managers like those at Parnassus Investments on the defensive.
articles.abstract: The explosion in index-tracking E.T.F.s and soaring tech stocks have put traditional mutual fund managers like those at Parnassus Investments on the defensive.
articles.lead_paragraph: Technology stocks had another scorching weeklong run last month, capped off by Amazon’s startling decision to buy Whole Foods for $13.4 billion.

articles.headline: The Network Against the Leader of the Free World
articles.snippet: President Trump, in a series of denunciations of CNN and a video depicting him wrestling it, is “trying to bully us,” said its president, Jeffrey Zucker.
articles.abstract: President Trump, in a series of denunciations of CNN and a video depicting him wrestling it, is “trying to bully us,” said its president, Jeffrey Zucker.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jeffrey A. Zucker hasn’t been getting a lot of sleep lately. But he says that’s nothing new.

articles.headline: How a CNN Investigation Set Off an Internet Meme War
articles.snippet: Internet meme creators are declaring war on CNN, after one of their own was investigated by the network.
articles.abstract: Internet meme creators are declaring war on CNN, after one of their own was investigated by the network.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Americans relaxed over a long Fourth of July weekend, the pro-Trump meme factories were gearing up for war.

articles.headline: Poor Patient Care at Many Nursing Homes Despite Stricter Oversight
articles.snippet: Homes forced to undergo the federal government’s strictest scrutiny often slide back into providing dangerous care.
articles.abstract: Homes forced to undergo the federal government’s strictest scrutiny often slide back into providing dangerous care.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2012, Parkview Healthcare Center’s history of safety violations led California regulators to issue an ultimatum reserved for the most dangerous nursing homes.

articles.headline: Oil Exports, Illegal for Decades, Now Fuel a Texas Port Boom
articles.snippet: Crude from West Texas shale fields is increasingly making its way abroad as a pipeline system is expanded to take it to market through Corpus Christi.
articles.abstract: Crude from West Texas shale fields is increasingly making its way abroad as a pipeline system is expanded to take it to market through Corpus Christi.
articles.lead_paragraph: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex. — In a twist that would have been unthinkable only two years ago, the oil tanker that arrives in China today may be carrying crude that left the South Texas port of Corpus Christi instead of Saudi Arabia.

articles.headline: Hopes of ‘Trump Bump’ for U.S. Economy Shrink as Growth Forecasts Fade
articles.snippet: After a once-heady outlook, estimates for the second quarter are being revised downward, and this year is looking more and more like the last several.
articles.abstract: After a once-heady outlook, estimates for the second quarter are being revised downward, and this year is looking more and more like the last several.
articles.lead_paragraph: The promise of faster economic growth has become a study in the triumph of hope over experience.

articles.headline: Trump, in Poland, Asks if West Has the ‘Will to Survive’
articles.snippet: He said Western civilization was at risk of decline, bringing a message about “radical Islamic terrorism” and “the creep of government bureaucracy” to Warsaw.
articles.abstract: He said Western civilization was at risk of decline, bringing a message about “radical Islamic terrorism” and “the creep of government bureaucracy” to Warsaw.
articles.lead_paragraph: WARSAW — President Trump said on Thursday that Western civilization was at risk of decline, bringing a message about “radical Islamic terrorism” and “the creep of government bureaucracy” to a European capital he views as hospitable to his nationalist message.
articles.byline: By Glenn Thrush and Julie Hirschfeld Davis

articles.headline: As E.U. and Japan Strengthen Trade Ties, U.S. Risks Losing Its Voice
articles.snippet: If completed, a deal between two American allies would diminish the role of U.S. companies in those markets while rebuking President Trump’s policies.
articles.abstract: If completed, a deal between two American allies would diminish the role of U.S. companies in those markets while rebuking President Trump’s policies.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — In the master plan advanced by President Trump, an unabashedly aggressive United States is supposed to reclaim its rightful perch as the center of the commercial universe, wielding its economic dominance to dictate the rules of global trade.
